text: Keg at the brewery. Light amber, clear and thin looking. Quite a bit of head initially. Malty, citrus and floral - almost perfumed - odour. Sweet taste with bitter astringency leading up to the long finish. Notes of vanilla and tangerine in the aftertaste. Pretty good although balance doesnt quite work for me.
Tap at Rapp. Aroma is toasted grains, honey, and light pine. Tastes great. Cereal grain, honey, And light burnt caramel. Solid stuff. A bit thin but that honey sweetness makes it so slammable.

UPDATED: NOV 4, 2015 Half growler sent to me from Tricyclist, huge thanks! Realize Ive become a weirdo when Im trading for Polotmavy but not immediate Czech travel plans has me leaning on Florida for help. Amber pour small sudsy head. Nose is light toffee and lager yeast. Tastes of lager yeast, toffee, bran muffin, earthy bitters, some dried leaves. Crisp and drying on palate. Easy drinking and the perfect Polotmavy for first of November evening.
Damn you Jtclockwork, only drinking this one because of you. Amber pour with tan head. Aromas are sweet lager tones. Flavors are sweet lager tones, probably the best Ive had by this style.

Growler with thanks to somebody who knows damn well to text me when a Polotmavy is on tap somewhere :) - thanks Sean! Pours crystal clear reddish orange, small off-white head, fizzy and quick to dissipate leaving some lacing behind. Aroma is bready, malty, grassy. Flavor is light sweet, light bitter, clean with notes of grass, hay and biscuit. Lightly acidic. Light plus body with a soft mouthfeel.

Draft at Rapp 3/16/2015. Dark amber color, aroma is spicy hops and caramel malt. Flavor has a freshness. Herbs and spicy hops in a medium body with fizzy carbonation. Brew is balanced by lager yeast and earthy spicy hops. Good
Draft. Nose is full of caramel. Taste is lightly sweet with a moderate bitterness. Very smooth and reminds me of a sweet Oktoberfest or Vienna lager kind of beer. Very clean.

Draft... Lightly hazy amber lager with a brief, wispy, white head. The faint aroma is a fusion of peppery hops and toffee. Medium to full-bodied with a whole-milk mouthfeel and buzzing carbonation. The flavor is that of a hopped-up amber ale  toasted, crunchy malts intertwined with spicy lupulin bitterness. Lengthy, bittersweet finish.

Draft at the tasting room in St. Pete, FL. Copper pour into a snifter with a medium white head. Aroma of spices, sweet malts, and cereal. The taste was similar with a very refreshing, different flavor than a regular Pilsener. Very clean, crisp, refreshing, and desirable. Finish has those blended spices and malts balanced well.
on tap during DANS Flabergasting Tour-white-gold. A-sweet lt malt. T-sweet lt malt, some spice hops.
Tap at the brewery... Copper thin tan lacing... Soft sweet malts.. Sift sweet toffee... Soft roast... Sweet toffee... Light dull toffee malt
draft at Rapp, different styled beer. amber orange pour, herbal, malty sweetness. herbal tea notes. Unique flavors
Very interesting, slightly smoky and acidic, like ash and caramel. Little bit of hominy. Slight sharpness, like sharp cheddar. Smooth maltiness, too.
On tap at Rapp. Cloudy amber pour with a white head. Light malty aromas. Pleasant malts, cereal, grassy hop notes. Crisp, clean, refreshing. Good body and mouthfeel.
Sampled @ the brewery. The aroma was bready and of dry hops. It tasted fresh of hops, caramel and just a touch of musty lemongrass in the finish. Palatable and crisp.

Tap at Rapp. It pours hazy amber with a medium off-white head. The nose is clean, brown bread, leather, sesame, earth and faint chlorine. The taste is brown bread, leather, caramel, spice, good level of bitterness, grass, wood and bran muffin with a dry, bitter finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. A very well balanced and drinkable hopped-up polotmavy!
On tap at Rapp. Nose is toast, biscuit, toffee, some caramel and grassy hop. Color is light brown colored. Flavor is similar with a toasted malt, toffee, and bitter hop finish. Pretty unique.
